--- title: "Field Experiments I" date: "March 7, 2023" format: html --- ## Overview The next two weeks are about field experiments, also known as randomized controlled trials (RCTs) or A/B testing. These are experiments aimed testing the impact of a policy intervention. Field experiments are diverse both in terms of design and their domains of application, hence the need for two weeks. The lab focuses on the stepped-wedge or staggered adoption design. ## Reading - {{< fa book >}} [RD section 18](https://book.declaredesign.org/library/experimental-causal.html) - {{< fa file-lines >}} Banerjee, Abhijit, Esther Duflo, and Garima Sharma. 2021. [“Long-Term Effects of the Targeting the Ultra Poor Program.”](https://www.nber.org/system/files/working_papers/w28074/w28074.pdf) *American Economic Review: Insights* 3 (4): 471-486 - {{< fa file-lines >}} Pennycook, Gordon, Ziv Epstein, Mohsen Mosleh, Antonio A. Arechar, Dean Eckles, and David G. Rand. 2021. [“Shifting attention to accuracy can reduce misinformation online.”](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-021-03344-2) *Nature* 592: 590-595 ## Slides ::: {.callout-tip} ## Navigation Click on the frame below and use the arrows to navigate. You can type ? (or shift + /) to see useful commands. :::
